VLIB_getblobIIBufSize

Detailed Description


Functions

int32_t VLIB_getblobIIBufSize (uint16_t height, int32_t maxNumIntervals, uint32_t *size)

Function Documentation

int32_t VLIB_getblobIIBufSize ( uint16_t  height,
int32_t  maxNumIntervals,
uint32_t *  size 
)

Description:
This function computes the buffer size required to allocate to the blob_ii buffer needed in the following functions: VLIB_createBlobIntervalImg, VLIB_calcBlobPerimeter, and VLIB_calcBlobMinEnclosedPolygon.
Parameters:
[in] height Number of rows in the image (UQ16.0)
[in] maxNumIntervals The value of the blobObj->maxNumItervals parameter at the output of the VLIB_createBlobList function. (SQ31.0)
[out] *size Returns the size in number of bytes to allocate to the blob_ii buffer. (UQ32.0)
Implementation Notes:
The formula for the size is: size = 12 + 8*(height + maxNumIntervals); These constants are based on the size of internal data structures used to store computation information.
Assumptions:
  • All pointers are assumed not aliased.
